Recommendations

If any device has a reported uptime of less than 30 days and no downtime was planned ins  previous report, then it is recommended to review events such as hardware freezes, HA failover, and reboots by reviewing the following logs: crashlogs, comlogs.

If CPU utilization thresholds have been breached in the last 30 days the alert counts are summarized in the table below

-No Event Data received this period.-
Recommendations

CPU Utilization is expected to follow a trend aligned to business schedules. Multiple high usage peaks that breach thresholds should be investigated for possible causes such as certain traffic peaks or specific traffic types, or even DDOS attacks; also by investigating CPU utilization per process with monitoring tools.

The table below shows the current disk utilization and free disk values of the devices.
Below is 12 records table of Assigned users By Resolution Time report
Recommendations
High disk utilization, or reduced free disk trends may be a result of device logging and log data storage; it is recommended to review logging configuration and retention policy.

elements.text: Recommendations

If any device has a reported uptime of less than 30 days and no downtime was planned ins  previous report, then it is recommended to review events such as hardware freezes, HA failover, and reboots by reviewing the following logs: crashlogs, comlogs.
Observations
The table below illustrates lowest, average and maximum firewall session counts for each firewall device measured over the 30 day period
Recommendations

The measured session data for each device should be compared against the device’s specified performance data. If the measured session data is tending towards these performance limits, then the solution capacity should be reviewed together with your technical and sales representatives. Performance data is available on device datasheets.
Observations
Recommendations

If HA failover failover events are observed, especially if they occur regularly or on multiple devices it is recommended to investigate further by correlating network incidents and networks device failures that would cause a network failover.
Observations
